channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Eileen Barrott death: Husband charged with murder
item.description: Eileen Barrott died at the couple's home a week ago after being found seriously injured.

item.title: Olympic boxer Ben Whittaker becomes Wolverhampton's mayor for a day
item.description: The silver medallist said in a post-bout interview in Tokyo he wanted to experience the honour.

item.title: Five hurt in high-speed crash at Lincoln car meet
item.description: Police say the five people were seriously injured when two cars went into spectators.

item.title: Ferrybridge chimney stacks demolished in controlled explosion
item.description: The controlled explosion takes place at a former coal-fired power station in West Yorkshire.

item.title: Man arrested over Birmingham Gay Village attack
item.description: Two men needed hospital treatment after the attack which began with abuse from inside a car.

item.title: Surfer gives father and son surfboards after car fire
item.description: Nathan Phillips gave the boards away after he saw the pair's car on fire on a road in Cornwall.

item.title: Widowed parents set up charity to help the bereaved
item.description: Wiltshire Moon and Stars aims to be a social support network for families going through loss.

item.title: Afghanistan: Trapped Nottingham family reach Dubai
item.description: The family with two young children were helped to escape from Kabul by the children's head teacher.

item.title: 'Race should not be a factor in my destiny'
item.description: A young Londoner beats 23,000 other entrants in one of the country's largest anti-racism competitions.

item.title: Formerly homeless asylum seeker retrains as vicar
item.description: A doctor who fled Nigeria to protect her daughters is starting to retrain as a vicar.

item.title: Devon girl, 14, finishes round-Britain sailing trek
item.description: Katie McCabe sails about 1,600 nautical miles in a 26ft (8m) wooden yacht called Falanda.

item.title: Teen gardener uses Instagram to promote mental health benefits
item.description: A teenager uses social media to encourage her peers to do more gardening to boost mental health.

item.title: Suffolk woodland workshop by Green Light Trust 'the best place in the world'
item.description: A former homeless man turns his life around thanks to the therapy gained from woodland workshops.

item.title: The woman who wants to break stereotypes in pageants and rugby
item.description: Danielle Evans wants to change minds on the pitch and the catwalk.

item.title: Injured Dubai cat flown to Bradford rescue centre
item.description: The cat was ‘left for dead’ until the centre paid for the transport to West Yorkshire.

item.title: The West End star who worked as carer during lockdown
item.description: As theatres reopen, actors like Stephen Beckett have been swapping their lockdown jobs for their place on the stage once more.

item.title: Westminster double murder: Police say wanted man knew victims
item.description: Detectives want to trace Lee Peacock after two people were found dead with knife injuries in London.

item.title: Mission: Impossible films Derbyshire quarry train crash
item.description: Crews had been building the set for months and the nearby village had seen lorry-loads of props appearing.

item.title: Banksy: Rusty old boat a 'godsend' destined for museum
item.description: The small metal "boat" under a painting of three children could become a museum piece.

item.title: William Arkle: Son opens gallery to display father's work
item.description: Prince Charles owns one of William Arkle's paintings and Tracey Emin had recently praised his work.

item.title: Driver cut free as car crashes into March house
item.description: The front of the bungalow was destroyed by a car crashed which through the wall.

item.title: Hillsborough: Minute's applause for 97th victim
item.description: Liverpool fans chanted "Justice for the 97" after the death of Andrew Devine who was hurt in the 1989 crush.

item.title: Cladding: Fire safety protest held over 'time bomb' homes
item.description: Residents from various developments in London and Manchester say they are living a "nightmare".

item.title: Kingston murder inquiry as man found stabbed
item.description: Two men arrested on suspicion of murder at the scene in Clarence Street, Kingston.

item.title: Abuse leaves hospitality staff at 'breaking point'
item.description: Staff say they are upset and feel demoralised by rude customers during a busy summer season.

item.title: Clapham Common rape: Police looking for two men
item.description: The victim, aged in his 30s, was attacked near a wooded area opposite The Avenue, Clapham.

item.title: BMX World Championships: Bethany Shriever takes women's final to add to Olympic title
item.description: Bethany Shriever completes an Olympic and World double as the Tokyo 2020 gold medallist wins the final of the women's BMX World Championships.

item.title: Arsenal 0-2 Chelsea: Romelu Lukaku scores as Blues win London derby
item.description: Romelu Lukaku scores his first ever Chelsea goal - almost a decade after his debut - as Thomas Tuchel's team deservedly beat Arsenal.

item.title: Wolverhampton Wanderers 0-1 Tottenham Hotspur: Dele Alli scores winner from penalty spot
item.description: Dele Alli scores the winner from the penalty spot as Spurs beat Wolves, with Harry Kane coming off the bench for the visitors.

item.title: Southampton 1-1 Man Utd: Mason Greenwood earns lacklustre visitors a point
item.description: Manchester United are held to a Premier League draw at Southampton, who claim their first point of the new campaign.
